page.title: 16BLACK ROCK NATURE RESERVE
page.content: Black Rock is a nature reserve and nature trail owned by the{National {Trust}and managed by the{Somerset {Trust For Nature Conservation}(STNC). It is set in 180 acres of grassland, woodland and limestone outcrops. Many distinctive plants can be found here inculding{Wall Pepper, {Spleenwort, Ragwort, Quaking Grass and {Rock Rose.}The last two are typical of dry, shallow limestone soils. In addition to over 200 species of wild flowers and trees, Black Rock has a number of butterfly varieties and birds, including birds of prey. Badger, rabbits, squirrels and foxes are all found here. It is a popular area for walkers and picnics and needs careful protection for its future survival.
